greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Gaussian binomial coefficients [ n,2 ] for q = 6.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..200
formula: a(n) = Product_{i=1..2} (6^(n-i+1)-1)/(6^i-1), by definition. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 16 2016
program: (Sage) [gaussian_binomial(n,2,6) for n in range(2,17)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 28 2009
(MAGMA) r:=2; q:=6; [&*[(1-q^(n-i+1))/(1-q^i): i in [1..r]]: n in [r..20]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 10 2016
(PARI) r=2; q=6; for(n=r,30, print1(prod(j=1,r,(1-q^(n-j+1))/(1-q^j)), ", ")) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jun 07 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
